author: Deleted User
content: <@!273808422753796097>, in your verkle tree code, you are using Kate commitments, I assume, because they are easier to experiment with? In your presentation you also mention FRI, which does not have trusted setup

author: Deleted User
content: and in your code, you are currently assuming that the tree is a perfect 16-ary (WIDTH=16) tree, which allows you to compute the position of each index in any level arithmetically. This is where I would see the application of B+-trees, so that you won't need to recalculate commitments in all the structures, but only in O(log N) number of them. But, of course, any self-balancing trees pose a question of the commitment being dependent of the order of modification. I do not think this is an insurmountable problem though,  and I have done a lot of thinking (and some experimenting) on this in the context of AVL+trees when working on early Ethermint
